===Etymology===
Probably composed in Japan of {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=かんおん}} elements as a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=かんおん|漢|tr1=kan|t1=Han Chinese|音|tr2=on|t2=sound}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|y=go|かんおん|acc=1|acc_ref=NHK,DJR|acc2=0|acc2_ref=NHK,DJR}}
* {{homophone|lang=ja|sort=かんおん|幹音|感恩}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|かんおん}}

# a Japanese reading of [[kanji]]
#: The ''kan'on'' readings are based mainly on the Chinese [[pronunciation]] in use in the areas around {{w|Chang'an}} (around modern-day {{w|Xi'an}}) and {{w|Henan}}, as imported into Japanese in the {{w|Nara period}} and the early {{w|Heian period}} in Japanese history, and roughly from the late {{w|Tang Dynasty}} through the early {{w|Song Dynasty}} in Chinese history.<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref><ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>
